Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a relic or spell supply pile. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player focuses one of their breaches.
Flavour: "I know it's powerful, but I kind of don't want to touch it." - Talix

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 7$ or more. These cards cost players 1$ less to gain.
Flavour: "I do not like to be restrained, even by choice. Let us end this quickly." - Soskel

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, that player deals 2 damage.
Flavour: "It's like it's literally woven out of aether. Makes my skin all tingly." - Razra

Effect: When a player opens a breach, that player gains 1 charge. At the start of any player's turn, if that player has no closed breaches, that player gains 1 charge.
Flavour: "From the stories my father told me, I am glad all we have left of this monster are bones." - Sahala

Effect: When a player opens a breach, that player deals 2 damage.
Flavour: "Life always grows back stronger." - Inco

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, any player may destroy a card in hand.
Flavour: "Then, I destroy what is unnecessary. First, I channel." - Nook

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell or relic supply pile. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, they deal 2 damage.
Flavour: "I read about Rageborne in the archives. We have grown much since then." - Mazra

Effect: When the last card in a supply pile is gained or destroyed, any player deals 6 damage.
Flavour: "Does holding this make anyone else feel hungry?" - Razra

Effect: When the last card in a supply pile is gained or destroyed, any player gains 3 charges.
Flavour: "What a powerful artifact! An entire flood inside one tiny finger." - Gygar

Effect: Once per turn during any player's main phase, that player may spend 4$ to focus each player's IV breach.
Flavour: "Our true strength is not in treasures, but in numbers." - Gygar

Effect: When the last card in a supply pile is gained or destroyed, any player gains 3 life.
Flavour: "It resembles a root, yes, but it is unnatural. The forest rejects is." - Inco

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 4$ or more. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains a charge.
Flavour: "All mages are connected. We draw from the same source of power." - Sahala

Effect: When a player opens a breach, that player may destroy a card in hand.
Flavour: "Focus your energy. Clarify. Use only what is vital." - Taqren

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, any ally gains a charge.
Flavour: "One for you, one for me!" - Claudia

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 4$ or more. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains 1 life.
Flavour: "What once took everything from us now gives back." - Taqren

Effect: When a player gains life, they gain an additional 1 life.
Flavour: "You definitely said edible, right Inco?" - Talix

Effect: When a player deals 6 or more damage to the nemesis with a single spell, add a power token to this card. At the start of the nemesis turn, the nemesis suffers damage equal to the number of tokens on this card.
Flavour: "Like the Void itself, all-consuming and inevitable." - Qu

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell supply pile that costs 6$ or more. Those spells deal 2 additional damage when cast.
Flavour: "This one packs a punch!" - Rhia

Effect: When a player opens a breach, any ally draws a card.
Flavour: "Even a chipped off piece of a Nameless can create enormous power." - Xaxos

Effect: When Gravehold gains life, Gravehold gains an additional 1 life.
Flavour: "The aether of energy and the aether of life are actually one and the same! We are the world we live in." - Ilya

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell supply pile that costs 5$ or less. Those spells deal 1 additional damage when cast.
Flavour: "An infection can fell a beast just as surely as any knife." - Kel

Effect: After a player finishes resolving their ability, any ally draws a card.
Flavour: "I'm beginning to grasp the importance of teamwork." - Ohat

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a gem supply pile. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains 1 charge.
Flavour: "Minerals are a girl's best friend." - Cairna

Effect: Once per turn during any player's main phase, that player may spend 3$ to have each player gain a charge.
Flavour: "Focus. Breathe. Expand your mind." - Lucien

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a supply pile that costs 7$ or more. When a player gains a card from that supply pile, that player gains 2 life.
Flavour: "It doesn't look tasty, but the effects are hard to ignore." - Reth

Effect: Once per turn after a player plays their second relic, any ally draws a card.
Flavour: "Void essence and aether are two sides of the same coin. Each impacts the other. I am living proof." - Qu

Effect: When a player becomes exhausted, do not resolve any on-exhaust effects. The players do not lose when all players are exhausted.
Flavour: "I wonder, sometimes. Can I truly die?" - Lost

Effect: When a player gains a card that costs 7$ or more, add a power token to this card. At the start of the nemesis turn, if the nemesis has exactly one turn order card in the turn order discard pile, the nemesis suffers damage equal to the number of tokens on this card.
Flavour: "I am not so old yet that I cannot stand up for humanity." - Z'hana

Effect: At the start of the game, set this next to a spell or supply pile that costs 6$ or more. These cards cost players 1$ less to gain.
Flavour: "Experience is the most importance factor in a battle, but I would never turn my back on a powerful tool." - Taqren
